name.japanese: ムシムシの実 モデル:カブトムシ
name.romanized: Mushi Mushi no Mi, Moderu: Kabutomushi

abilities.description: Allows the user to transform into a rhinoceros beetle or a human-rhinoceros beetle hybrid. In this form, the user gains the ability to fly and enhanced strength characteristic of beetles.

weaknesses: Standard Devil Fruit weaknesses: inability to swim, vulnerability to Sea-Prism Stone and Haki

keyMoments.description: Kabu reveals his Devil Fruit ability by transforming into his hybrid form at the Tontatta Airline to prepare for transporting Usopp and Robin.
keyMoments.significance: First display of a Tontatta dwarf with Devil Fruit powers.

name.japanese: ムシムシの実 モデル:スズメバチ
name.romanized: Mushi Mushi no Mi, Moderu: Suzumebachi

abilities.description: Allows the user to transform into a hornet or a human-hornet hybrid. In this form, the user gains the ability to fly and potentially use stinger attacks.

weaknesses: Standard Devil Fruit weaknesses: inability to swim, vulnerability to Sea-Prism Stone and Haki

keyMoments.description: Bian reveals her Devil Fruit ability at the Tontatta Airline, demonstrating the Tontatta tribe's combat capabilities.
keyMoments.significance: Second display of a Tontatta dwarf with insect-based Devil Fruit powers.

abilities.description: Allows the user to transform objects and living beings into abstract works of art by throwing colored clouds at them. Transformed objects lose their functionality and become useless art pieces.

weaknesses: Standard Devil Fruit weaknesses: inability to swim, vulnerability to Sea-Prism Stone and Haki
The transformations can potentially be reversed

keyMoments.description: Giolla fully demonstrates her Ato Ato no Mi powers on the Thousand Sunny, transforming Nami's Clima-Tact, Chopper's body parts, and Brook's Soul Solid into useless art pieces.
keyMoments.significance: Full revelation of the Art-Art Fruit's bizarre and dangerous abilities that render weapons and physical forms dysfunctional.
